Digital NSW 2024: AI Assessment Framework

This document outlines Digital NSW's commitment to the safe and responsible implementation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) within the New South Wales (NSW) government. Released on 1 July 2024, it represents an update to the existing AI Assessment Framework, designed to address evolving risks and opportunities associated with AI technology. The core principle driving this initiative is to leverage AI's potential for enhanced productivity, economic growth, and improved public services, while simultaneously upholding ethical standards and maintaining public trust. Specifically, the framework focuses on establishing ‚Äòguardrails‚Äô for the design, deployment, and use of AI systems across various government applications. The NSW government is already utilizing AI in several key areas, including bolstering community safety through bushfire intelligence, monitoring environmental health via smart sensors, and enhancing educational services, exemplified by the NSW EduChat platform. Transparency is a central tenet, emphasizing the need to openly communicate about the methodologies and approaches employed in AI applications. The update to the framework reflects a proactive approach to managing emerging risks and capitalizing on new opportunities presented by AI. The document underscores the government's leadership role in responsible AI adoption, aiming to align AI usage with community expectations and the highest ethical considerations. The ongoing evolution of the framework demonstrates a commitment to continuous improvement and adaptation in the face of rapidly advancing AI technology. It‚Äôs a strategic document designed to guide the government‚Äôs approach to AI, ensuring it‚Äôs used effectively and ethically to benefit the people of NSW.

Key Concepts:

  • Safe and Responsible AI Use
  • AI Assessment Framework for Risk Management
  • Government Services Transformation through AI
  • Maintaining Public Trust in Government
  • AI Applications in Community Safety and Environmental Monitoring
  • Elevated risk assessment and mitigation
  • Appropriate use of AI in different use cases
  • Output validation for language models and generative AI
  • Independent review process for elevated risks
